channel.title: Cant seem to Figure out whats wrong with my PortForwarding
channel.description:
Ok I made a static IP. Opened ports 43594 on router. Made a .no-ip. And opened port 43594 through firewall.
and still no one can connect to my server please help.
I'm Using Vista and I have a Belkin router.

item.title: Cant seem to Figure out whats wrong with my PortForwarding
item.dc:creator: @pleya2 pleya2
item.description:
@pleya2 wrote:

Doesn’t work either[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 02, 2009, 02:10:47 am[/size][hr]Please some one help me I dont know whats wrong.

If anything it might be the client- Im using dragonscape 525.

Read full topic

item.title: Cant seem to Figure out whats wrong with my PortForwarding
item.dc:creator: @pleya2 pleya2
item.description:
@pleya2 wrote:

I can connect to my server.

Other ppl cant connect to it using no-ip.

And I already used the port checker it said port not reachable.

Read full topic
item.source: Cant seem to Figure out whats wrong with my PortForwarding

item.title: Cant seem to Figure out whats wrong with my PortForwarding
item.dc:creator: @jake_93 jake_93
item.description:
@jake_93 wrote:

are you conneting to your no-ip address?

If so change it so you connect to 127.0.0.1
But the other people who use your client should connect to you no-ip address.

Should work fine then

If that don’t work then you should download port checker from www.portfoward.com to check if your port is opened correctly.

Jake

Read full topic
